titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Rachel Dunaway Cox (1904-1996) was a professor of education and psychology at Bryn Mawr College from 1944 to 1971. She was chair of the Department of Education and Child Development and the director of the Child Study Institute. A leader in the field of child development, she published studies focusing on youth and young adults for academic publications, and occasionally also wrote articles for popular magazines.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of papers of Rachel Dunaway Cox. Included are lectures, bibliographies and student papers from a course on Advanced Clinical Evaluation. The collection also contains records relating to the Hester Adrian Research Centre for the Study of Learning Processes in the Mentally Handicapped including questionnaires, workshop notes, and progress reports on the Centre's work.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library: Rachel Dunaway Cox papers.
